author: petehatz
title: Small SPO awareness
description: Not many small pools have the funds to market and get set up with a website, or any other barriers that are keeping them from being known.

assessments.note: no description of how to achieve it yet, more work to be done.
People who are interested in staking on Cardano are already in the ecosystem to some degree. This proposal does not address the goal of reaching new people.

The goal within the "Proposer outreach" campaign is to attract entrepreneurs and companies from all over the world to learn about Catalyst and make them submit proposals of high quality. 

A key metric for this campaign is:
"Ideas submitted from new members of the community."

I fail to understand the connection between marketing for small SPO's and how that would result in new proposals for the Catalyst project. Therefore I will give this proposal a score of 1.
How does this bring prospers from outside the Cardano community in to make proposals. SPO's are already in the comunity.

The idea states a problem which needs to be solved, however it is not coherent with this challenge. Maybe if you unite this idea with creating awareness of Cardano's environment to people outside this ecosystem and if it's clear for them that entering in this world, they will have the opportunity to be more than a delegator, because your channel creates awareness of small SPO as well, it might be more aligned with the challenge.

It is not clear how interviewing people that are already part of cardano in the role of SPO would help bringing ideas for future funds. I can imagine that it may inspire people to run their own stake pools, but that's not the goal of this challenge.

There are already youtubers that do interviews with small SPO owners. And there is a support programm directly from IOHK. There aren't enough details in this proposal to see how exactly this would benefit cardano.

Draft Proposal. The problem and solution described are not related to the challenge, but to the disclosure of SPOs. The absence of a plan, metrics and goals makes it impossible to indicate the impact of the proposal.

Bringing small stake pool operators in front of as many people is a good idea in attracting new people to the Cardano community and also a way to diversify staking even more. But the concept should have contained details regarding the video structure, its marketing and launch date.
As the proposer admits, "Ive never done a YT vid, never wanted to. But for the love of ADA...I'm willing to sacrifice my time to learn, and grow the network/comunity"

The proposer self-identifies as a stakepool operator and marketing professional (among other things), but does not indicate their qualifications in the proposal to turn this into a reality. On the contrary, the proposer acknowledges the lack of expertise.

This proposal asks for 10% of the whole "Proposer outreach" campaign yet, there is no clear budget or time plan presented. The proposer mentions in the comments that the funds will go towards gear for high quality videos but I would like a detailed budget in order to be comfortable to support this proposal in the future. 
Another questionable factor is the proposers lack of experience and his disinterest to make videos before.
I do not want to be rude but this proposal is very low-effort and needs an elaborated plan of how you would implement your proposal successfully. With the information provided, I do not believe that this proposal will be successful.
The proposer does not have the experience to make the videos (stated). More importantly no plan is actually detailed.

You do not need much to create content on YT, if it's very basic, just need confidence, will power, a cell phone and internet. One of the biggest channels in Brazil, if not the biggest, start like this – will power and confidence (Whindersson Nunes). However, to create a well-produced, well-guided and written interviews, you need more than that.
Need more explanation why you are asking this amount of money.  
This idea needs to be lapidated and became an actual project.

There is no plan associated with the proposal and the proposer admits not to have experience with videos and/or youtube, so this looks like a bit risky to me. However, they states to be marketing professional, so this should help a bit. Anyway, I would like to see more effort on the presentation of the plan given the lack of experience.

It is really hard to start a Youtube channel from zero. Given that the proposer has no experience it is hard to see the proposal beeing successfully. It would have been something else if there was already a youtube channel where you could check the previous videos. I would recommend to start such a channel anyways and then if it starts to take of maybe ask for additional funding.
Draft proposal. There is no plan and the proposer has no experience with video production. I recommend including a detailed plan and submitting the proposal to an appropriate challenge.

The proposer only describes his past experience, but has provided no links to attest it. There is also no detailed plan, making it impossible to assess the project. Recommend a re-submission to a next fund, after the proposer is able to write a more complete project and maybe joins teams with other community members who have more experience on the video side.

No metrics stated, also, given the YT channel, it would be very tricky too. 

I addressed the proposer how would he measure it, he just replied that "as more people would know about it, more people would join", but no tools how to measure it.
It is unclear how $10,000 would be allocated to interview "as many small stakepool operators" as the proposer can.

This proposal lacks information about a plan for implementation and key metrics to evaluate the proposals success in the future. This makes the integrity of the proposal questionable.
I do not believe small SPO awareness videos would bring in new members and proposals in the future in an effective manner. The interview aspect of videos are an interesting topic but I think you would have to change the focus to address project Catalyst in some way, in order to address the goal of this campaign.
There is no detailed plan and it is not stated how this idea addresses the challenge.
There is no roadmap with milestones, no metrics/KPI.

There are no milestones, deliverables or timelines. The budget is not partitioned and it is unclear what it will be used for. The amount of work is also not scoped, so it's hard to asses what a failure / success is judging only from the short outline
The proposal is really short. Unfortunately there is no information on how exactly the funds are being used or how the proposer plans to measure the success of his youtube channel.
Draft proposal. There is no information to assess the auditability. I recommend following the Catalyst documentation to elaborate the proposal.
There is no detailed description, no plan, no metrics, no prior experience given. As stated above, I recommend re-submission to a future fund.

solution: i am looking to solve this by setting up a youtube channel, and take the time to interview as many small stake pool operators as i can.
experience: Ive never done a YT vid, never wanted to. But for the love of ADA...I'm willing to sacrifice my time to learn, and grow the network/comunity
